name: Transparent Governance
title: High Public Sector Integrity
description: Cape Verde scores a 4.5 out of 6 in transparency, accountability, and corruption in the public sector, indicating a strong commitment to integrity in governance as of 2023.

name: Efficient Administration
title: Quality Public Administration
description: With a CPIA rating of 4 out of 6 in 2023, Cape Verde demonstrates effective public administration, reflecting its ability to manage resources and implement policies efficiently.

name: Coal Dependency
title: High Coal Rent Dependency
description: In 2021, coal rents accounted for 17.18% of Cape Verde's GDP, highlighting a significant reliance on coal for economic stability.

name: Low Innovation
title: Minimal Patent Activity
description: Cape Verde had only 1 patent application by nonresidents in 2021, indicating limited innovation and technological advancement.

name: Agricultural Challenges
title: Low Cereal Yield
description: With a cereal yield of 11.5 kg per hectare in 2022, Cape Verde faces significant challenges in agricultural productivity.

name: HIV Concern
title: Children Living with HIV
description: In 2022, 100 children aged 0-14 were living with HIV in Cape Verde, highlighting a public health concern that requires attention.

name: Minimal Metal Exports
title: Negligible Ores and Metals Exports
description: In 2023, ores and metals constituted only 0.000058% of Cape Verde's merchandise exports, indicating a minimal contribution to the export economy.
